United States.description: US websites must comply with the ADA and Section 508 accessibility standards.

United Kingdom.description: UK law requires websites to be accessible under the Equality Act 2010, aligned with WCAG 2.1.

European Union.description: EU directive requires websites and apps to meet WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards.

Canada.description: Ontario's Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) enforces WCAG compliance for public-facing websites.

Australia.description: Australia requires websites to provide equal access under the Disability Discrimination Act (DDA).
